channel.title: How can i make it so no1 can log onto my server but me?
channel.description: title says it. is there a way to make it so only i can log on? or maybe only me and like a few ppl i want to log on with me?

item.title: How can i make it so no1 can log onto my server but me?
item.dc:creator: @slim_2021 slim_2021
item.description:
@slim_2021 wrote:

java, that gave me 5 errors…

client.java:9783: cannot find symbol symbol : variable oneLogger location: class server if(server.oneLogger == false) { ^ client.java:9784: cannot find symbol symbol : variable oneLogger location: class server server.oneLogger = true; ^ client.java:9786: cannot find symbol symbol : variable oneLogger location: class server } else if(server.oneLogger == true) { ^ client.java:9787: cannot find symbol symbol : variable oneLogger location: class server server.oneLogger = false; ^ server.java:161: cannot find symbol symbol : variable oneLogger location: class server if (Found < 3 && oneLogger == fa lse) { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 5 errors Press any key to continue . . .[code/]

Read full topic
item.source: How can i make it so no1 can log onto my server but me?

item.title: How can i make it so no1 can log onto my server but me?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

In server class put:

if(connectingHost.equalsIgnoreCase(“localhost”)) {
// w.e

} else {
s.close();

–
You find out where to put it or even easier make a command.

–
In server class add:

public boolean oneLogger;

Search:

if (Found < 3

make it look like this:

if (Found < 3 && oneLogger == false) { playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost); } else { s.close(); }

In client class make the command.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("onelog")) { if(server.oneLogger == false) { server.oneLogger = true; sendMessage("No one else can log on!"); } else if(server.oneLogger == true) { server.oneLogger = false; sendMessage("Lock disabled!"); } }

–

[quote=“Mod Adam, post:3, topic:175847”][code]java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();

if (connectingHost.startsWith(“IP ADDRESS OF YOU”)) {
s.accept();
else
s.close();
}[/code]

Maybe that’d work? Someone correct me if I’m wrong please.[/quote]

He might get already declared because it is probably being used for something else.

Read full topic

item.title: How can i make it so no1 can log onto my server but me?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[code]java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();

if (connectingHost.startsWith(“IP ADDRESS OF YOU”)) {
s.accept();
else
s.close();
}[/code]

Maybe that’d work? Someone correct me if I’m wrong please.
